indeed, I wasn't trying to correct you mate, just taking all possible 
opportunities to have a dig at Gordon LOL. It would be much easier to 
all be on the same time but of course but I would probably have to go to 
work in the middle of the night and try and sleep in the broad daylight. 
Looking at swords would be a drag as well. Oh well, happy April fools to 
you all, in case you need a laugh  
http://www.museumofhoaxes.com/aprilfool2.html

Sorry for this digression, there was a tiny bit of sword content in there.

Rich



alchemyst wrote:

> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@w...>
> wrote:
> > That was yesterday Gordon, I think he is serious, he is digging out
> his
> > Pamela Anderson Tsuba for me to see :-)
> >
> > Rich T
> >
>
> Rich -
>
> It is April 1 here today. Of course my today was your yesterday
> and your today is my tomorrow ---huh??? Who said time travel
> wasn't possible. I tend to forget that about the time I'm
> trying to drag this stiff, decrepit old body out of bed, you're
> just winding down from a long night of drinking, carousing
> and croc wrestling :-) Who came up with this time difference
> stuff anyway?? Much too confusing for old geezers like me.
>
> Rich S
>
>
